name: Adam's Apple
description: great riff with Aerosmith's classic rock goodness.

name: Caught A Glimpse
description: One of the most inventive rock songs ever recorded. Still stands the test of time.

name: Goodbye Yellow Brick Road
description: Elton works his magic on the piano with great band orchestration bringing a difficult musical composition into an accessible sound.

name: The End
description: This tune began a great southern rock album with a little irony.

name: (Teach You How To) Sing The Blues
description: If you've never seen the Lemy documentary, go watch it. Now. Grandfather of metal brings it.

name: If The House Burns Down Tonight
description: This is my current psych-up song. The San Diego surfers bring it again

name: Real Thing
description: If you want to broaden your sonic horizons, check this one out. It shouldn't work, but it does.

name: Every Breaking Wave
description: This song was performed on U2's recent tour in acoustic version, but the original is worth a listen. So good.

name: Acrobat
description: This lesser known hit from the Irishmen shows a depth that often is overlooked after so many hits.

name: Even Better Than The Real Thing
description: U2 took this remake of their hit song and it became a live staple on the 360 Tour.
